keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was convicted in 2008 for soliciting an underage girl for prostitution and served 13 months in prison.
Epstein founded his financial management firm, J. Epstein & Co., in 1982, managing assets of clients with over $1 billion in net worth.
Leslie Wexner became a notable client of Epstein's firm in 1987.
Epstein and Mortimer Zuckerman were equal partners in financing Radar magazine.
Epstein changed the name of his firm to the Financial Trust Company in 1996 and relocated it to St. Thomas for tax advantages.
